(on loan from [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]) | clubnumber = 7 | youthyears1 = {{0|0000}}–2015 | youthclubs1 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C. Villa]] (loan) | caps2 = 33 | goals2 = 4 | years3 = 2018– | clubs3 = → [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] (loan) | caps3 = 12 | goals3 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam1 = | nationalcaps2 = 13 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps3 = 6 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps4 = 14 | nationalgoals4 = 4 | nationalyears5 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam5 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps5 = 10 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | nationalyears6 = 2016– | nationalteam6 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps6 = 8 | nationalgoals6 = 2 | club-update = 22:20, 2 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 18:29, 16 October 2018 (UTC) }} '''Joshua Oghenetega Peter Onomah''' (born 27 April 1997) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]], on loan from [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].{{Cite news|title=Josh Onomah checks in|url=https://www.swfc.co.uk/news/2018/august/josh-onomah-checks-in/|publisher=Sheff Wed Official Site|date=31 August 2018|accessdate=31 August 2018}} Onomah has been a regular youth international for [[England national football team|England]], including winning the [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] and the [[2014 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship]]. ==Club career== ===Tottenham Hotspur=== Born in [[London Borough of Enfield|Enfield]],{{cite web|title=JOSHUA ONOMAH|url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/second-year-academy/joshua-onomah/|publisher=[[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.]]|accessdate=15 January 2015}}, Onomah came through the academy system at [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]. He was first called up for the first team on 5 January 2015, remaining an unused substitute in their 1–1 draw away to [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in the [[FA Cup]] third round,{{cite news|last1=Dawkes|first1=Phil|title=Burnley 1–1 Tottenham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30620968|accessdate=1 June 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=5 January 2015}} and made his debut nine days later in the replay, replacing [[Andros Townsend]] for the last 15 minutes of a 4–2 victory at [[White Hart Lane]].{{cite news|last1=McMath|first1=James|title=Tottenham 4–2 Burnley|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30706058|accessdate=15 January 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=14 January 2015}} On 24 May, he was included in the matchday squad for a [[Premier League]] game for the first time, remaining unused as Tottenham won 0–1 at [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in the last game of the season.{{cite news|last1=Magowan|first1=Alistair|title=Everton 0–1 Tottenham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32770847|accessdate=1 June 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=24 May 2015}} In the 2015–16 season, Onomah changed his shirt number to 25, which was included on the club's list of first-team numbers.{{cite web|title=2015–16 Premier League squad numbers announced|url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/squad-numbers-070815/|publisher=Tottenham Hotspur|accessdate=6 November 2015|date=7 August 2015}} He made his Premier League debut in a 3–1 home victory over [[Aston Villa]] on 2 November 2015, replacing [[Dele Alli]] for the final minutes.{{cite news|last1=Magowan|first1=Alistair|title=Tottenham 3–1 Aston Villa|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34634659|accessdate=3 November 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 November 2015}} On 10 December, Onomah made his first start for Tottenham playing 90 minutes in a 4–1 victory over [[AS Monaco]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35055753|title=Tottenham Hotspur 4–1 Monaco|date=10 December 2015|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}} ====Loan to Aston Villa==== On 4 August 2017, Onomah joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on loan for the season.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/aug/04/tottenham-josh-onomah-aston-villa-loan|title=Transfer roundup: Tottenham’s Josh Onomah joins Aston Villa on loan|website=Guardian|last=Hytner|first=David|date=4 August 2017|accessdate=4 August 2017}} He scored his first goal for Aston Villa in a 1–1 draw at [[Bristol City]] on 25 August 2017.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40970867 |title=Bristol City 1–1 Aston Villa |publisher=BBC |date=25 August 2017 |accessdate=29 August 2017}} ====Loan to Sheffield Wednesday==== On 31 August 2018, Onomah joined Championship side [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] on loan for the season.{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/transfer/news/11703/11486788/tottenhams-josh-onomah-joins-sheffield-wednesday-on-loan|title=Josh Onomah joins Sheffield Wednesday on loan|website=SkySports|date=31 August 2018|accessdate=31 August 2018}} ==International career== Onomah has represented England up to under-21 level. In May 2014, Onomah was part of the [[England national under-17 football team|England squad]] that won the [[2014 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]], playing the full 90 minutes in the final against the [[Netherlands national under-17 football team|Netherlands]].{{cite news|title=Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Joshua Onomah helped England win Under-17 European Championship against the Netherlands tonight|url=http://www.croydonguardian.co.uk/sport/football/premierleague/news_articles/11228327.Spurs_midfielder_helps_England_win_Under_17_European_Championship/|accessdate=15 January 2015|work=[[Croydon Guardian]]|date=21 May 2014}} In 2015, Onomah scored the equaliser against [[Croatia national under-19 football team|Croatia U-19]] in a 1–1 draw.{{cite news|last1=Shergold|first1=Adam|title=Croatia U19 1–1 England U19: Josh Onomah salvages friendly draw for the Young Lions|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3226455/Croatia-U19-1-1-England-U19-Josh-Onomah-salvages-draw-Young-Lions.html|accessdate=6 November 2015|work=Daily Mail|date=8 September 2015}} During the elite round of [[2016 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualification]], held in March 2016, Onomah scored in wins against [[Georgia national under-19 football team|Georgia]] and group hosts [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain]] as England qualified for the final tournament by winning the group.[http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2016/matches/round=2000602/match=2019176/postmatch/index.html"Under-19 2016 – England-Georgia"] UEFA.com. 24 March 2016. Retrieved 30 March 2016.[http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2016/matches/round=2000602/match=2019203/index.html"Under-19 2016 – England-Spain"] UEFA.com. 29 March 2016. Retrieved 30 March 2016. Onomah represented England at the 2016 UEFA European Under-19 Championship and made 4 appearances in the tournament where England finished semi-finalists.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2016/matches/round=2000598/match=2019792/index.html |title=England hold off France fightback|date= 12 July 2016 |work=UEFA.com }} ===2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup=== Onomah was in the [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20 team]] in the [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup]]. He received a red card in the quarter-finals match against [[Mexico national under-20 football team|Mexico]], so he missed the semi-final against [[Italy national under-20 football team|Italy]].{{cite news |url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40158561 |title=Under-20 World Cup: England beat Mexico 1–0 to reach semi-finals |date= 5 June 2017 |work=BBC Sport }} He returned for the final where England beat [[Venezuela national under-20 football team|Venezuela]] 1–0, which is England's first win in a global tournament since their [[1966 FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] victory of 1966.{{cite news |url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40237981 |title= Under-20 World Cup: England beat Venezuela in final |work=BBC Sport |date= 11 June 2017 | }} ==Club statistics== {{updated|match played 2 February 2019}} {{soccerway|joshua-onomah/274469|accessdate=26 May 2018}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club
